title: Victory over Og and Moses’ Plea
summary: Deuteronomy 3 recounts Israel’s victory over King Og of Bashan and the allocation of land to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half of Manasseh. Moses pleads to enter the Promised Land but God denies the request, allowing him only to view it from a mountain.

faq.question: Who was Og of Bashan?
faq.answer: A powerful king whose land was conquered and given to Israel.

faq.question: Why couldn't Moses enter the Promised Land?
faq.answer: Because of his earlier disobedience at Meribah (striking the rock).
